Desa Fiktif, Kemendagri: Ratusan yang Terlibat pun Harus Diproses
07 Nov 2019, 01:16 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Desa Fiktif, Kemendagri: Ratusan yang Terlibat pun Harus Diproses

KBRN, Jakarta : Kepala Pusat Penerangan Kementerian Dalam Negeri (Kapuspen Kemendagri), Bachtiar mengatakan, kasus desa fiktif murni merupakan kasus pidana. Sebab sebagaimana istilahnya, desa tersebut sesungguhnya tidak ada dalam alam nyata. Berapa ratus orang yang terlibat pun harus diproses hukum.Hal itu diungkapkannya menanggapi temuan 34 desa yang diduga fiktif di Kabupaten Konawe, Provinsi Sulawesi Tenggara (Sultra) dalam kasus yang tengah ditangani oleh Polda Sultra yang berkoordinasi dengan Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi KPK."Itu kalimatnya saja sudah mengandung pidana. Desa fiktif, desa angan-angan kan. Berarti kalau desa fiktif berarti tidak ada di dalam alam nyata, desanya ada di langit itu," katanya saat berbincang dengan Radio Republik Indonesia, Rabu (6/11/2019).Lebih lanjut menurut dia, jika sesuai dengan amanat Undang-Undang Nomor 6 Tahun 2014 tentang Desa, peraturan pemerintah, peraturan menteri, bahkan sampai peraturan daerah, mestinya kasus desa fiktif tidak ada. Untuk itu menurut dia, kalaupun memang ditemukan adanya kecurangan atau manipulasi dalam kasus tersebut, maka penegak hukum harus menindak tegas. "Biarlah nanti kepolisian ya, aparat penegak hukum yang mengungkap semua ini. Mau siapa, dinas pendapatan daerah atau siapapun yang terlibat, apakah ada masyarakat yang terlibat harus diungkap semua," tegasnya.Perlu diketahui, dugaan tindak pidana korupsi membentuk desa tidak sesuai prosedur sah berakibat  pada kerugian keuangan negara atau daerah atas Dana Desa (DD) serta Alokasi Dana Desa (ADD) yang dikelola beberapa desa di Kabupaten Konawe Tahun Anggaran 2016 sampai dengan Tahun Anggaran 2018.Terkait dugaan kasus korupsi itu, ditegaskannya pula bahwa Kemendagri tak akan mentolerir. Siapapun dan berapa banyak orang yang terlibat pun harus diseret ke meja hukum."Berapa ratus orang pun yang terlibat harus ditangkap semua. Kemendagri tidak pernah mentolerir perbuatan pidana seperti itu. Itukan merugikan masyarakat," pungkasnya kembali menegaskan. (Foto: Tangkap Layar YouTube Humas Kemendagri)

Fictitious Village, Ministry of Home Affairs: Even Hundreds Involved Must Be Processed
Nov 7 2019, 01:16 by Bunaiya Fauzi Arubone


Fictitious Village, Ministry of Home Affairs: Even Hundreds Involved Must Be Processed

KBRN, Jakarta: Head of the Ministry of Home Affairs Information Center (Kapuspen Kemendagri), Bachtiar said, the purely fictitious village case is a criminal case. Because as the term implies, the village does not actually exist in the real world. How many hundred people were involved must be prosecuted. He revealed that in response to the findings of 34 villages suspected to be fictitious in Konawe District, Southeast Sulawesi Province in the case being handled by the Southeast Sulawesi Regional Police in coordination with the Corruption Eradication Commission of the Corruption Eradication Commission. already contain a crime. Fictitious village, wishful village right. Means that if the fictitious village means that it does not exist in the real world, the village is in the sky, "he said while talking with Radio Republik Indonesia, Wednesday (11/06/2019). according to him, if it is in accordance with the mandate of Law Number 6 of 2014 concerning Villages, government regulations, ministerial regulations, even local regulations, there should be no fictitious village cases. For this reason, according to him, even if fraud or manipulation is found in the case, then law enforcement must take firm action. "Let the police later, law enforcement officers reveal all of this. Whoever, the regional revenue agency or whoever is involved, is there any community involved," he stressed. It should be known, the alleged corruption of forming a village is not in accordance with legal procedures resulting in state or regional financial losses to the Village Fund (DD) and the Village Fund Allocation (ADD) managed by several villages in Konawe Regency in the 2016 Fiscal Year to 2018 Fiscal Year. Regarding the alleged corruption case, he also emphasized that the Ministry of Home Affairs would not tolerate. Whoever and how many people are involved must be dragged to the legal table. "How many hundred people are involved must be arrested. The Ministry of Home Affairs has never tolerated such criminal acts. That is detrimental to the community," he concluded reiterating.
